I joined @AppropsDems because it is the best place to give more people a better chance at a better life. With these appropriations bills, we have lived up to that promise by making historic investments #ForThePeople.

Indian Point has provided significant economic help to the municipalities, school district, & businesses near the plant. With the imminent closure of the plant, I have been working with local officials to find ways to build up the tax base. Our efforts are producing real results.

I heard the serious concerns of the communities surrounding Indian Point loud & clear. I‚Äôm proud to have secured $15 million to create a program that will help the Lower Hudson Valley deal with the economic burden of the Indian Point Energy Center‚Äôs closure.

It has been my absolute pleasure to fight alongside @GiffordsCourage and other groups advocating for this monumental step.   https://giffords.org/press-release/2019/12/statement-gun-violence-research-announcement-win/¬†‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/AqGmztJR19

I am pleased to announce that as Chairwoman of @AppropsDems, I secured a historic $25 million investment for gun violence prevention research. The best public health researchers in the country will be put to work to identify ways to reduce injury and death due to firearms.

Since 1996, I have been fighting to give public health researches the tools to study the causes of firearm injury in the hopes that more Americans can be spared from violence, suicide, and firearm-related accidents. This research will finally go forward.
Nearly 40,000 lives are lost each year at the hands of a firearm, yet Republicans and the NRA refuse to acknowledge that gun violence is a public health emergency.
